alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 03 at 2:28PM CST until January 03 at 3:15PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Monroe County in south central Alabama... Northeastern Clarke County in southwestern Alabama... Southwestern Wilcox County in south central Alabama... * Until 315 PM CST. * At 227 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Grove Hill, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Camden, Grove Hill, Vredenburgh and Fulton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
